website_summaries.verdict: This is the best smart outlet on the market right now, but unless you're committed to splurging on a seamless smart home, you're better off just going with a plug-in smart switch.
pros: The iDevices Wall Outlet works well with both Siri and Alexa, letting you turn whatever's plugged into each outlet on and off using your voice
Installation is straightforward, and you don't need to connect it with a hub
cons: $100 per outlet is a lot to ask for integrated, plug-in smarts

customer_reviews.title: No Network Connection
customer_reviews.text: What they don’t tell you is iDevices Wall outlet will not work with some WiFi Routers. I really wanted it to work, however after researching online, there are a list of routers known not to work. Routers known not to work are listed on iDevices website. Be sure to check for yours before you purchase. Wish I did.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Over priced, but does work great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is beyond over priced. I can not wait for other companies to come out with this product that works with HomeKit so that it will become a little more affordable. I have 1 of them and I absolutely love it. I just won't be buying another one at this price. $50 should be the absolute max price. That aside, It was easy to install, works perfectly, every time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly everything it is supposed to do. The problem is the cost is completely outrageous! Since the iDevices Switch IDEV0001P that costs about $28 is no longer available, this in the wall solution is now all that iDevices offers. This product quite simply should not cost more than $28 for what it is, what it does, and how well it does it. When the price gets down to a realistic price, I will probably buy about 20 of these.
customer_reviews.author: freerock

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: This outlet was easy to install and works great. Alexa integration works perfectly and the iDevices app works well also. I have many iDevices products and I am happy with their products. I purchased this outlet because I wanted to be able to control it with my iDevices app. The price was the only thing giving me second thoughts, but I went ahead and made the purchase and I am satisfied. Wi-Fi connection has been flawless through my Orbi router system. I will continue to buy iDevices products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: D. Elkins

customer_reviews.title: The only HomeKit outlet in the market
customer_reviews.text: I needed a HomeKit enabled outlet and looked everywhere. It seems this is the only one made. Fortunately it is a very good outlet and worked perfectly from the first install. I plan to get 3 more that I already need and upgrade other outlets if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: ATMH

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.text: Love my plug! And there app works with other smart devices!! Works great with Apple home kit. And they send updates to the firmware! This company is serious about there product! Will be great when the price on this type of product decreases! Can’t replace a lot of plugs and switches at once!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit integration is great, the duplex is too! Great job all around
customer_reviews.text: iDevices did great with this one. This is the only WiFi - No Hub Required - HomeKit compatible Duplex I could find (there may be others, if you know of any, please let me know). The iOS HomeKit app and the iDevices app work great with this thing. With the iDevices app you can track power usage. Each plug can be turned on and off individually with your iOS device or with a mechanical switch on the duplex itself. There is also a nightlight that is included on the duplex, which is great for small kids. You can even change the color of the nightlight and its intensity right from the app. All in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely no home-repair or modification skills and yet I was able, with the help of iDevices you-tube video, to install this wall outlet in less than an hour. I struggles with ensuring all wires of the same color were well-adheded and I used some electrical tape for assurance. The outlet was easy to set-up and is working flawlessly, turning my Technivorm coffee maker on each morning prior to me getting out of bed. I had previously used another manufacturer's bluetooth based outlet plug and although it worked well, the iDevices wall outlet is quicker, more responsive and much cleaner appearing. As a caveat, I used the existing metal wall plate and had no wi-fi reception issues.
customer_reviews.author: MikeRN10

customer_reviews.title: Plays well with others.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a smart outlet to control my water fountain in the back yard. I have a Lutron system controlling my lights, but they didn’t have a recepticals. IDevices was easy to install and works within the Lutron App. Set up a schedule and has been working as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Best outlet on the market.  But can it connect to a hub?
customer_reviews.text: The outlet is the best on the market. But, can it connect to a hub? Not being able to connect to a hub is a problem because wireless routers get bogged down. I'm worried it won't work as I install more. TO THE ENGINEERS: CAN I BUY A WIRELESS ROUTER TO ACT AS A HUB FOR THESE?
customer_reviews.author: K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Hopes dashed
customer_reviews.text: This was not a hard outlet to install. It only took a few minutes. However, no matter what I did or how many times I reset it, it would not go into pairing mode to connect to my wifi router. I eventually gave up and sent it back. I now have a Vocolinc smart plug in its place working brilliantly for 1/5th the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chainring

customer_reviews.title: Very good receptacle
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until i reinstalled it to a humid environment- it didn’t like that- - my bad- it says not to
customer_reviews.author: Eric N.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I know, it's very over-priced, but the setup was easy and it works great. I'm using it to control a custom neon sign on my party pavilion. I just tell siri to turn it off or on.
customer_reviews.author: telehack

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works as advertised. Just way overpriced. If it was cheaper I would have bought more of them. If you don’t need or mind the external blocks of the competitors, you can buy double for the same price. If you don’t have space for the block sticking out then this is the product for you. Once installed, it appears as a normal wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: D. F.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works well, on the phone or with Siri. Sometimes glitches, but still works after around 2 years
customer_reviews.author: Erik de Perik

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean look plug with a timer capability.
customer_reviews.text: Installed for purpose of using for our Christmas tree timer. Worked beautifully for the season. Able to exit the timer for a full time normal electrical plug.
customer_reviews.author: William Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Controlling a garage heater from Florida. We love in the Midwest
customer_reviews.author: Sherman J Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Expected!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the scheduling feature. Works great for plugging in the Christmas lights.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and easy to set up with HomeKit
customer_reviews.author: Carlos m

customer_reviews.title: WIFI connection is a great idea but still has a long way to go in home automation.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. If you live in a condo or location with high Wifi density these units will start to become flaky at best. We live in a condo and have 10 of this company's products and they are offline more than they are online. Had to remove them from the bedroom completely because when they go offline they emit a very bright LED light. If you are the only WIFI in the area these should work fine. Starting to see the advantage to having a HUB for this sort of home automation so they do not have to rely on WIFI directly.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Durham

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi outlet, no hub needed.
customer_reviews.text: Love this outlet! No hub needed, easy to install and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Guidi

customer_reviews.title: Our home is so much smarter now!
customer_reviews.text: These outlets work great and integrate well with my iPhone Home apps and Siri voice commands. I love that you can program the two outlets separately.
customer_reviews.author: David Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey, but worth it. Works really well with HomeKit and Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: John H Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but there aren’t a lot of options, and this one does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.author: G. Warren

customer_reviews.title: but I love the functionality
customer_reviews.text: iDevices accessories are a little pricey, but I love the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: rdlink

customer_reviews.title: You should check the iDevices app work in your country ...
customer_reviews.text: You should check the iDevices app work in your country or not. The size does not fit to my junction box either.
customer_reviews.author: LIU, CHIH WEI

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Technology
customer_reviews.text: Technology comes natural to me, however, I have never had a harder time pairing this device to the iOS app. In fact it still won’t pair. Even after going through the Home Kit exercise of entering the numbers, registering the WiFi, it gives an indication that pairing was successful only to then announce that it found the same device all over again and needs to pair. Just pathetic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fast response on Wifi with Homekit
customer_reviews.text: This outlet is amazingly fast on Homekit - you can turn it on and off as fast as you can click the outlet in the app - highly recommended. Each outlet can be switched independently. The price is a bit high and it can be a bit difficult to get into an older box, but other than that it's amazing - I'd love to have all my outlets use these.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: We have a regular "dumb" table lamp (no smart bulb), which is a perfect pairing with this smart outlet. We plug the lamp into this wall outlet (we had it professionally installed) and then just keep the lamp switched on. Since this works with Alexa, all we have to do is to shout out to any of our Alexa units to "turn on the hallway lamp" and presto - illumination! There's also an iDevices app you can use, but since we have so many Echo's around the house, we're never more than a whisper away from controlling this outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Jish M.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy wiring - don't touch it.
customer_reviews.text: Crappy multi-core aluminium wiring, permanently attached to the device. No screw terminals so that you can attach your own wiring. Cheep plastics. Works well with HomeKit though. Definately won't buy more because of the crappy wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Beelsebob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, flawless with Echo/Alexa
customer_reviews.text: This is my second iDevices product, and like the lightswitch, it installed easily (so says my handyman), setup was simple (so says me), and integration with Alexa was flawless. It didn't let me down. There's not much more to say about it. I have dozens of smart-stuff in my house. Lots of smart plus, thermostats, switches, etc. I've had a pretty good experience overall. What I can tell you is that I believe that you will not have a single regret about this purchase - at least, assuming you're hoping to use it with Amazon Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: No hassle Alexa interface
customer_reviews.text: My sone is unsung this outlet to control a light using Alexa. Installation was easy, and the app works fine for setup. It probably does more than my son uses it for, but we don’t exercise the app much since our goal was the Alexa connection. We found this very comparable to the TP Link and Wemo product equivalents. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: P. MSakamoto

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly on iOS with Linksys Velop
customer_reviews.text: We have many of these units in our home and setup is flawless usimg the iOS App on iPhones with the Linksys Velop tri-band system. Black Friday deals make iDevices units even sweeter.
customer_reviews.author: K. Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, but the price tag is a bit too high compared with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Doffod

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is great...but using the App is where the issues start.
customer_reviews.text: I'm REALLY trying to like this product. We've been trying to sync with the the iDevices app for over a week. It's super buggy. I've opened a support ticket and their customer service is trying to walk us through. I'm pretty "techy" and love to troubleshoot. But now I'm just irritated. I will update when (if) I can resolve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Heter

product_meta.title: iDevices Wall Outlet - Wi-Fi enabled smart outlet; Works with Alexa, Siri, the Google Assistant
product_meta.description: Take your smart home to the next level with the iDevices Wall Outlet - the only Wi-Fi enabled in-wall outlet featuring HomeKit and Alexa compatibility. With intelligent features such as individual outlet control and energy monitoring, the iDevices Wall Outlet provides powerful functionality anywhere in your home without the need for a central hub or gateway. Conveniently control and schedule the iDevices Wall Outlet from anywhere using the power of your voice through Siri, Alexa, Android and more. Just say, "Alexa, turn on the desk light", and watch your home come to life. Tech Specs: 2 Individually controlled outlets Input: 125VAC, 60Hz Output: 125VAC, 60Hz Tungsten: 600W (5A) General Use: 15A Motor: 1/2 HP Resistive: 1800W (15A)
feature_bullets: VOICE CONTROL: Responds to Alexa, Siri, and Google Assistant voice commands (voice assistant sold separately)
ACCESS ANYWHERE: Control your electronics from anywhere using any iOS/Android device and the iDevices Connected app, no hub or additional hardware required
INDEPENDENT OUTLET CONTROL: Control and schedule both the top and bottom receptacles independently with the app or voice commands
WORKS WITH IFTTT: Do even more with Wall Outlet by connecting to hundreds of apps and web services for whole home automation
2-YEAR WARRANTY: Backed by a 2-year limited warranty and U.S.-based customer experience team

specifications.Included Components: 1 iDevices Wall Outlet, iDevices Install Guide, Mounting Hardware
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars104 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
